text: Emerald Lake is a lake located in the Trinity Alps Wilderness area, in Northern California. The lake sits in a granite bowl, approximately above sea level. It is dammed with a rock wall constructed many years ago when the area was used by miners. Visitors can still find old rusty pieces of their equipment around the lake, including giant gears, winches, and cables. Visitors can access the lake by hiking the Stuart Fork Trail, and the lake is downstream of Sapphire Lake. ==See also== *List of lakes in California ==References== Category:Klamath Mountains Category:Lakes of Trinity County, California Category:Lakes of California Category:Lakes of Northern California
title: Emerald Lake (Trinity County, California)
